meanings.definition: To steal a car by force
meanings.sent1: The thief carjacks vehicles late at night.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often carjacks cars to sell them illegally.
meanings.sent3: When the carjacker tried to steal a car, he accidentally pressed the horn and alerted everyone.
meanings.sent4: The storm carjacks the peaceful atmosphere, leaving chaos in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The idea of someone trying to carjack my car terrifies me.

meanings.definition: A device used to lift a car for maintenance
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used carjacks to change the tires.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use carjacks when working under a vehicle for safety.
meanings.sent3: The carjacks in the garage always seem to have a mind of their own, moving around when not in use.
meanings.sent4: The carjacks stood tall like loyal servants, ready to assist in any repair.
meanings.sent5: The carjacks creaked under the weight of the car, but held it steady.

meanings.definition: Plural form of carjack, referring to multiple incidents of stealing cars by force
meanings.sent1: The city experienced a wave of carjacks last month.
meanings.sent2: Police are investigating the recent carjacks in the area.
meanings.sent3: The news reported a group of carjacks who were caught trying to steal luxury cars.
meanings.sent4: The carjacks in this neighborhood have increased, causing concern among residents.
meanings.sent5: Witnesses described the carjacks as swift and organized in their operations.
